post: 🧠 What happens when you challenge young people to change their communities? You get civic innovation and a whole lot of inspiration. This fall, the Bill of Rights Institute is bringing MyImpact Challenge Civics Fairs to Texas and Florida thanks to our sponsor Travelers. 📍 Dallas | Sept. 13 at the Dallas Holocaust and Human Rights Museum 📍 Orlando | Oct. 11 at the University of Central Florida At each event, students ages 13–19 will showcase service projects aligned with BRIs Founding Principles and Civic Virtues, or pitch ideas to earn seed funding for a project they believe in. 💡 Up to $2,000 in prizes 💡 2 ways to participate 💡 1 big opportunity to shape the future 🔗 Read the full announcement:  https://bit.ly/45W0b6v  #CivicEducation  #MyImpactChallenge  #YouthLeadership  #StudentVoice  #TexasStudents  #FloridaStudents  #EdLeadership  #StudentGrants

Veteran-owned and civics-aligned. Star Spangled Tea Coffee Co. offers regionally inspired blends with stories that honor Americas past. Use code BRI1791 to save while supporting civic education with every cup. 🍵 Shop here:  https://bit.ly/46ald2T  #TeaTime  #HistoryLovers  #VeteranOwned  #CivicEducation

Congratulations to Jennifer Button, a finalist for BRIs National Civics Teacher of the Year Award! Jennifers 20 years in education have been dedicated to helping students connect deeply with the Constitution and develop the skills for civic life. 🔗 Check out how Jennifers inspiring her students:  https://bit.ly/4mzERux  #CivicTeachers  #TeacherRecognition  #CivicEducation  #TeachingMatters

Did you know Dr. King called the Constitution a promissory note  and the Declaration an uncashed check ? His 1963 March on Washington was a powerful step toward fulfilling Americas promise of liberty and equality. 🎥 Watch the full video now:  https://bit.ly/47O4ymA  #MarchOnWashington  #MLK  #CivicEducation  #USHistory  #CivilRights

🖋️ August is National Make-A-Will Month, a time to protect what matters and plan for the future. At the Bill of Rights Institute, we believe investing in civic education is one of the most meaningful legacies you can leave. By including BRI in your will or estate plans, you ensure that future generations of students will engage with Americas Founding Principles and civic virtues. Planned giving donors are welcomed into our James Madison Legacy Society, with special recognition, a framed copy of the Bill of Rights, and personal thanks from a BRI educator. 📖 Learn more about how to support BRI through planned giving here:  https://bit.ly/45BHw0X  #PlannedGiving  #LegacyGiving  #CivicEducation  #MakeAWillMonth  #EstatePlanning

At the inaugural Debate & Leadership Institute cohosted with Founding Forward, 48 high school students from 17 states came together at Valley Forge to strengthen their debate skills, study civic responsibility, and walk in the footsteps of Americas founders. From tackling questions about the balance of power in government to discussing On Liberty, students left with the tools to engage in civil discourse and lead in their communities. How can we better prepare young people to disagree well and lead with integrity? Wed love to hear your thoughts. 🔗 Read more:  https://bit.ly/47OenRx  #CivicEducation  #Debate  #LeadershipDevelopment  #CivilDiscourse

Were thankful to Speak for Yourself for their support of our Civics for Everyone initiative. Speak for Yourself is an organization helping non-speaking students engage in meaningful civic dialogue using accessible AAC technology. Learn how you can support our Civics for Everyone initiative:  https://bit.ly/4jBYuQp  #CivicsForEveryone  #EdEquity  #AAC  #Inclusion  #StudentVoice

Were proud to announce the 10 finalists for the Bill of Rights Institutes National Civics Teacher of the Year Award! These educators inspire students to understand our nations history and their rights & responsibilities as citizens. Thanks to FileWave for sponsoring this years award. 🔗  https://bit.ly/464FiqY  #CivicEducation  #CivicTeachers  #TeacherRecognition  #EdChat

Kick off the Civic Star Challenge by choosing the theme that fits your classroom best 🌟 📘 Voting & Civic Engagement 📘 Revolution & Change 📘 Equality 📘 …and many more! Get started ➡️  https://bit.ly/4fOChOR  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #TeachersOfInstagram  #EdChat  #SocialStudies  #America250  #K12Teachers 📚🌟

#OTD, 250 years ago, King George III declared the American colonies to be in a state of rebellion. Read the text of the Kings proclamation and ask yourself, what was the significance of this moment, and why does this moment still matter to our national story? Discover more:  https://bit.ly/47Isxnc  #TDiH  #BRI250  #  #AmericanRevolution  #CivicIdentity
